summary: Request to automatically compile TypeScript code when running a worker, eliminating the need for users to maintain a separate watch process. This would streamline local development by combining compilation and worker execution into a single command.
userImpact: Users currently need to manage multiple terminal processes for development; automatic compilation would simplify the local development setup.
proposedFix: Integrate TypeScript compilation into the worker startup process, potentially leveraging webpack for source map generation.
workaround: Maintain a separate terminal process that watches for file changes and invokes the TypeScript compiler.
resolutionDetails: Implemented as part of the SDK's development tooling improvements.
keyQuote: It would be great if running a worker did the compilation too. That way I could only run the worker in some cases.
